009package imagingbook.pub.hough;
010
011import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
014import java.util.ArrayList;
015import java.util.Collections;
016import java.util.List;
017
018import ij.IJ;
019import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
020import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
021import imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic;
022import imagingbook.lib.util.ParameterBundle;
023import imagingbook.pub.hough.lines.HoughLine;
024
025
026/**
027 * This class implements the "classic" Hough Transform for straight lines.
028 * This implementation improves the algorithm described in the textbook in
029 * the way the accumulator is updated. Here, the quantity 1 is not added
030 * to a single accumulator cell but gets distributed over two neighboring
031 * (radial) cells to reduce aliasing effects. Thus we accumulate non-integer
032 * values and therefore the various accumulators are of type {@code float[][]}.
033 *
034 * 
035 * TODO: add bias correction
036 * 
037 * @author W. Burger
038 * @version 2020/12/13
039 */
040public class HoughTransformLines {
041
042        public static class Parameters implements ParameterBundle {
043                /** Number of angular steps over [0, pi] */
044                public int nAng = 256;
045                /** Number of radial steps in each pos/neg direction (accum. size = 2 * nRad + 1) */
046                public int nRad = 128;
047                public boolean showProgress = true;
048                public boolean showCheckImage = true;
049                public boolean debug = false;
050        }
051
052        private final Parameters params;
053
054        private final int nAng; // number of angular steps over [0, pi]
055        private final int nRad; // number of radial steps in each pos/neg direction
056
057        private final int width, height; // size of the reference frame (image)
058        private final double xRef, yRef; // reference point (x/y-coordinate of image center)
059
060        private final double dAng; // increment of angle
061        private final double dRad; // increment of radius
062        private final int cRad; // array index representing the zero radius
063
064        private final int accWidth; // width of the accumulator array (angular direction)
065        private final int accHeight; // height of the accumulator array (radial direction)
066        private final float[][] accumulator; // accumulator array
067        private final float[][] accumulatorExt; // extended accumulator array
068        private final float[][] accumulatorMax; // accumulator, with local maxima only
069
070        private final double[] cosTable; // tabulated cosine values
071        private final double[] sinTable; // tabulated sine values
072
073        // -------------- public constructor(s) ------------------------
074
075        /**
076         * Creates a new Hough transform from the image I.
077         * 
078         * @param I      input image, relevant (edge) points have pixel values greater 0.
079         * @param params parameter object.
080         */
081        public HoughTransformLines(ImageProcessor I, Parameters params) {
082                this(I.getWidth(), I.getHeight(), params);
083                this.process(I, accumulator);
084        }
085        
086        public HoughTransformLines(ImageProcessor I) {
087                this(I, new Parameters());
088        }
089
090        /**
091         * Creates a new Hough transform from a sequence of 2D points. Parameters M, N
092         * are only used to specify the reference point (usually at the center of the
093         * image). Use this constructor if the relevant image points are collected
094         * separately.
095         * 
096         * @param points an array of 2D points.
097         * @param width      width of the corresponding image plane.
098         * @param height      height of the corresponding image plane.
099         * @param params parameter object.
100         */
101        public HoughTransformLines(Point2D[] points, int width, int height, Parameters params) {
102                this(width, height, params);
103                this.process(points, accumulator);
104        }
105
106        // Non-public constructor used by public constructors (to set up all final
107        // members variables).
108        private HoughTransformLines(int width, int height, Parameters params) {
109                this.params = (params == null) ? new Parameters() : params;
110                this.width = width;
111                this.height = height;
112                this.xRef = width / 2; // integer value
113                this.yRef = height / 2; // integer value
114                this.nAng = params.nAng;
115                this.nRad = params.nRad;
116                this.dAng = Math.PI / nAng;
117                this.dRad = 0.5 * Math.hypot(width, height) / nRad; // nRad radial steps over half the diagonal length
118                this.cRad = nRad;
119                this.accWidth = nAng;
120                this.accHeight = nRad + 1 + nRad;
121                this.accumulator = new float[accWidth][accHeight]; // cells are initialized to zero!
122                this.accumulatorExt = new float[2 * accWidth][accHeight];
123                this.accumulatorMax = new float[accWidth][accHeight];
124                this.cosTable = makeCosTable();
125                this.sinTable = makeSinTable();
126        }
127
128        // -------------- public methods ------------------------
129
130        /**
131         * Finds and returns the parameters of the strongest lines with a specified min.
132         * pixel count. All objects in the returned array are valid, but the array may
133         * be empty. Note: Could perhaps be implemented more efficiently with
134         * insert-sort.
135         * 
136         * @param amin the minimum accumulator value for each line.
137         * @param maxLines maximum number of (strongest) lines to extract.
138         * @return a possibly empty array of {@link HoughLine} objects.
139         */
140        public HoughLine[] getLines(int amin, int maxLines) {
141                makeAccumulatorExt();   // TODO: should not be here
142                findLocalMaxima();
143                // collect all lines corresponding to accumulator maxima
144                List<HoughLine> lines = new ArrayList<>();
145                for (int ri = 0; ri < accHeight; ri++) {
146                        for (int ai = 0; ai < accWidth; ai++) {
147                                int hcount = (int) accumulatorMax[ai][ri];
148                                if (hcount >= amin) {
149                                        double angle = angleFromIndex(ai);
150                                        double radius = radiusFromIndex(ri);
151                                        lines.add(new HoughLine(angle, radius, xRef, yRef, hcount));
152                                }
153                        }
154                }
155                // sort 'lines' by count (highest counts first)
156                Collections.sort(lines);
157                List<HoughLine> slines = lines.subList(0, Math.min(maxLines, lines.size()));
158                // convert the list to an array and return:
159                return slines.toArray(new HoughLine[0]);
160        }
161        
162        /**
163         * Returns the reference points x-coordinate.
164         * @return as described.
165         */
166        public double getXref() {
167                return xRef;
168        }
169        
170        /**
171         * Returns the reference points y-coordinate.
172         * @return as described.
173         */
174        public double getYref() {
175                return yRef;
176        }
177
178        /**
179         * Calculates the actual angle (in radians) for angle index {@code ai}
180         * 
181         * @param ai angle index [0,...,nAng-1]
182         * @return Angle [0,...,PI] for angle index ai
183         */
184        public double angleFromIndex(int ai) {
185                return ai * dAng;
186        }
187
188        /**
189         * Calculates the actual radius for radius index ri.
190         * 
191         * @param ri radius index [0,...,nRad-1].
192         * @return Radius [-maxRad,...,maxRad] with respect to reference point (xc, yc).
193         */
194        public double radiusFromIndex(int ri) {
195                return (ri - cRad) * dRad;
196        }
197
198        public double radiusToIndex(double rad) {
199                return cRad + rad / dRad;
200        }
201        
202        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
203
204        /**
205         * Returns the accumulator as a 2D float-array.
206         * @return the contents of the accumulator
207         */
208        public float[][] getAccumulator() {
209                return this.accumulator;
210        }
211
212        /**
213         * Returns the local maximum values of the accumulator as a 2D float-array
214         * (all non-maximum elements are set to zero).
215         * @return the local maximum values of the accumulator 
216         */
217        public float[][] getAccumulatorMax() {
218                return this.accumulatorMax;
219        }
220        
221        /**
222         * Returns the extended accumulator as a 2D float-array.
223         * @return the extended accumulator
224         */
225        public float[][] getAccumulatorExtended() {
226                return this.accumulatorExt;
227        }
228        
229
230        /**
231         * Creates and returns an image of the 2D accumulator array.
232         * @return a {@link FloatProcessor} image of the accumulator
233         */
234        public FloatProcessor getAccumulatorImage() {
235                return new FloatProcessor(accumulator);
236        }
237        
238
239        /**
240         * Creates and returns an image of the extended 2D accumulator array, produced
241         * by adding a vertically mirrored copy of the accumulator to its right end. 
242         * @return a {@link FloatProcessor} image of the extended accumulator
243         */
244        public FloatProcessor getAccumulatorImageExtended() {
245                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(accumulatorExt);
246                return fp;
247        }
248
249        /**
250         * Creates and returns an image of the local maxima of the 2D accumulator array.
251         * @return a {@link FloatProcessor} image of the accumulator maxima
252         */
253        public FloatProcessor getAccumulatorMaxImage() {
254                return new FloatProcessor(accumulatorMax);
255        }
256
257        // -------------- nonpublic methods ------------------------
258
259        private double[] makeCosTable() {
260                double[] cosTab = new double[nAng];
261                for (int ai = 0; ai < nAng; ai++) {
262                        double angle = dAng * ai;
263                        cosTab[ai] = Math.cos(angle);
264                }
265                return cosTab;
266        }
267
268        private double[] makeSinTable() {
269                double[] sinTab = new double[nAng];
270                for (int ai = 0; ai < nAng; ai++) {
271                        double angle = dAng * ai;
272                        sinTab[ai] = Math.sin(angle);
273                }
274                return sinTab;
275        }
276
277        private void process(ImageProcessor ip, float[][] acc) {
278                if (params.showProgress)
279                        IJ.showStatus("filling accumulator ...");
280                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
281                        if (params.showProgress)
282                                IJ.showProgress(v, height);
283                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
284                                if ((0xFFFFFF & ip.get(u, v)) != 0) { // this is a foreground (edge) pixel - use ImageAccessor??
285                                        processPoint(u, v, acc);
286                                }
287                        }
288                }
289                if (params.showProgress)
290                        IJ.showProgress(1, 1);
291        }
292
293        private void process(Point2D[] points, float[][] acc) {
294                if (params.showProgress)
295                        IJ.showStatus("filling accumulator ...");
296                for (int i = 0; i < points.length; i++) {
297                        if (params.showProgress && i % 50 == 0)
298                                IJ.showProgress(i, points.length);
299                        Point2D p = points[i];
300                        if (p != null) {
301                                processPoint(p.getX(), p.getY(), acc);
302                        }
303                }
304                if (params.showProgress)
305                        IJ.showProgress(1, 1);
306        }
307
308        private void processPoint(double u, double v, float[][] acc) {
309                final double x = u - xRef;
310                final double y = v - yRef;
311                for (int ai = 0; ai < accWidth; ai++) {
312//                      double theta = dAng * ai;
313//                      double r = x * Math.cos(theta) + y * Math.sin(theta);
314                        double r = x * cosTable[ai] + y * sinTable[ai]; // sin/cos tables improve speed!
315                        double ri = radiusToIndex(r);
316                        // accumulated quantity (1.0) is distributed to 2 neighboring bins:
317                        int r0 = (int) Math.floor(ri);  // lower radial bin index
318                        int r1 = r0 + 1;                                // upper radial bin index
319                        if (r0 >= 0 && r1 < accHeight) {
320                                double alpha = ri - r0;
321                                acc[ai][r0] += (1.0 - alpha);
322                                acc[ai][r1] += alpha;
323                        }
324                }
325        }
326        
327        /**
328         * Searches for local maxima in the extended accumulator but enters their
329         * positions in 'accumulatorMax'.
330         */
331        private void findLocalMaxima() {
332                if (params.showProgress)
333                        IJ.showStatus("finding local maxima");
334                int count = 0;
335                for (int ai = 1; ai <= accWidth; ai++) {        // note the range!
336                        for (int ri = 1; ri < accHeight - 1; ri++) {
337                                float vC = accumulatorExt[ai][ri];      // center value
338                                boolean ismax = 
339                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai + 1][ri]     && // 0
340                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai + 1][ri - 1] && // 1
341                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai]    [ri - 1] && // 2
342                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai - 1][ri - 1] && // 3
343                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai - 1][ri]     && // 4
344                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai - 1][ri + 1] && // 5
345                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai]    [ri + 1] && // 6
346                                        vC > accumulatorExt[ai + 1][ri + 1];   // 7
347                                if (ismax) {
348                                        if (ai < accWidth)
349                                                accumulatorMax[ai % accWidth][ri] = vC; // take care of ai == accWidth
350                                        else
351                                                accumulatorMax[ai % accWidth][accHeight - ri - 1] = vC;
352                                        count++;
353                                }
354                        }
355                }
356                if (params.debug)
357                        IJ.log("found maxima: " + count);
358        }
359        
360        /**
361         * Creates the extended 2D accumulator array 
362         */
363        private void makeAccumulatorExt() {
364                if (params.showProgress)
365                        IJ.showStatus("making extended accumulator");
366                for (int ai = 0; ai < accWidth; ai++) {
367                        for (int ri = 0; ri < accHeight; ri++) {
368                                // insert original accumulator into the left side
369                                accumulatorExt[ai][ri] = accumulator[ai][ri];
370                                // insert a vertically flipped copy of accumulator into the right side
371                                accumulatorExt[accWidth + ai][ri] = accumulator[ai][accHeight - ri - 1];
372                        }
373                }
374        }
375        
376}
377
378
